thread.title: Tucker Carlson’s Ratings Continue To Soar
thread.title_full: Tucker Carlson’s Ratings Continue To Soar

author: Jack Davis
title: Tucker Carlson’s Ratings Continue To Soar
text:
Trump Brands Pelosi ‘Incompetent,’Praises His Accomplishments 
Nielsen data reported that Carlson on Thursday, March 2, had the fourth-highest ratings in all of television. 
As a testimony to the impact that political news in the early days of the Trump administration had in upending viewers’ habits, Rachel Maddow of MSNBC came in with the sixth-highest ratings in her time slot opposite Carlson. 
Thursday’s episode of Tucker Carlson Tonight delivered 3.489 million viewers. The Rachel Maddow Show had 2.532 million. Advertisement - story continues below 
Both shows came only two days after President Donald Trump’s address to a joint session of Congress and during intense news coverage of meetings between Attorney General Jeff Session and Russia’s ambassador to the U.S. 
Carlson March 2 ratings were hardly a fluke. 
In February, Carlson was up 31 percent in total viewers over Megyn Kelly’s former show The Kelly File. Carlson averaged 3.28 million viewers. In the key 25- to 54-year-old age demographic, Carlson was up 55 percent over Kelly with 695,000 viewers. 
Carlson’s show began when Kelly announced she would be leaving Fox for NBC. Advertisement - story continues below
